item.title: Trouble with fighting
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

That would be NPC.class. I’m pretty damn sure npc.cfg says this:

//----NpcID-----NpcName-------------------------combat--health npc = 0 Hans 0 0 npc = 1 Man 2 7 npc = 2 Man 2 7 npc = 3 Man 2 7 npc = 4 Woman 2 0 npc = 5 Woman 2 0 npc = 6 Woman 2 0 npc = 7 Farmer 7 12 npc = 8 Thief 16 17 npc = 9 Guard 21 22 npc = 10 Guard 22 0 npc = 11 Tramp 2 0 npc = 12 Barbarian 7 0 npc = 13 Wizard 9 0 npc = 14 Druid 33 0 npc = 15 Warrior_woman 24 0 npc = 16 Man 2 0 npc = 17 Barbarian_woman 8 0 npc = 18 Al-Kharid_warrior 9 0 npc = 19 White_Knight 36 0 npc = 20 Paladin 62 0 npc = 21 Hero 69 0 npc = 22 Forester 15 0 npc = 23 Knight_of_Ardougne 46 0 npc = 24 Man 2 0 npc = 25 Woman 2 0 npc = 26 Knight_of_Ardougne 46 0 npc = 27 Archer 37 0 npc = 28 Zoo_keeper 0 0 npc = 29 Chuck 1 0 npc = 30 Barman 0 0 npc = 31 Priest 0 0

item.title: Trouble with fighting
item.dc:creator: @owner_Ethan owner Ethan
item.description:
@owner_Ethan wrote:

no dragon scape 2.3 has 80hp for all npcs

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble with fighting
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

I would possibly assume that you haven’t define a HP for the npc in npc.cfg. You have to go in there, it will say something at the top like ID # ------ ----- Name ----------------- HP -----------Combat LVL

The hp will be blank or 0 on the npc most likely, change it to a number > 0 and it should work. I think the max hp bar is 175 or so, meaning if you do more HP, you will get it to 0 hp bar, then it will refill.

Read full topic
